q_root.prompt: What do you need help with?

options.label: I want to cancel a subscription
I pay for too many services
I don’t know what I’m paying for

q_reduce_2a.prompt: Do you use most subscriptions weekly?

options.label: I can switch some to yearly

q_reduce_4a.prompt: Are you comfortable paying upfront to save long-term?

a_reduce_yearly_yes.title: Try yearly plans for key apps
a_reduce_yearly_yes.body: Pick 1–2 services you’re confident you’ll keep and switch them to yearly billing. You’ll reduce monthly cash-flow pressure and often save 10–20%.
tips: Start with productivity tools you use daily
Avoid switching services you might cancel soon
Set a reminder 30 days before yearly renewals

a_reduce_yearly_no.title: Stay monthly and optimize usage
a_reduce_yearly_no.body: If upfront payments aren’t ideal, keep monthly but pause or rotate services. For example, subscribe to one streaming app per month and switch next month.

q_reduce_4b.prompt: Do you have multiple services in the same category (e.g., streaming)?

q_reduce_5b.prompt: Would you be okay rotating them month to month?

a_reduce_rotate.title: Rotate subscriptions to cut costs
a_reduce_rotate.body: Pause one service and use another for a month. Rotating keeps your spend low without feeling like you’re missing out.
tips: Pause services you haven’t opened in 14+ days

a_reduce_bundle.title: Look for bundles and family plans
a_reduce_bundle.body: If you prefer keeping multiple services, check for bundles (streaming packs) or split costs via family plans where allowed.

a_reduce_simple.title: Quick win: pause 1 low-value service
a_reduce_simple.body: Pick the least-used service and pause it for one billing cycle. If you don’t miss it, cancel it.

a_reduce_downgrade.title: Downgrade to a cheaper tier
a_reduce_downgrade.body: Downgrading often preserves most features. Track usage for 7 days, then switch to the lowest plan that still fits.

a_reduce_replace.title: Replace with a cheaper alternative
a_reduce_replace.body: If there’s only one plan, compare competitors. Switching one service can reduce your monthly total significantly.

a_reduce_cancel_expensive.title: Cancel the expensive service
a_reduce_cancel_expensive.body: If it’s not essential, cancel and reassess in 30 days. You can always resubscribe later.

q_reduce_2c.prompt: Do you want to audit by category or by renewal date?

a_reduce_audit_category.title: Audit by category
a_reduce_audit_category.body: Open Analytics and look for your top category. Reduce duplication there first—this has the biggest impact.

a_reduce_audit_renewals.title: Audit upcoming renewals
a_reduce_audit_renewals.body: Start with renewals in the next 7 days. If you’re not using a service, pause or cancel before it renews.

a_renewal_enable.title: Enable renewal reminders
a_renewal_enable.body: Turn on renewal reminders in Profile → Preferences. The app will create local reminders for renewals within 7 days.

a_renewal_off.title: No worries
a_renewal_off.body: You can keep reminders off. Tip: set a calendar reminder 2–3 days before renewals for important subscriptions.

q_renewal_2b.prompt: How do you want to respond to the price increase?

a_renewal_downgrade.title: Downgrade the plan
a_renewal_downgrade.body: If the service offers tiers, downgrade. You’ll keep access while lowering your monthly spend.

a_renewal_switch.title: Switch providers
a_renewal_switch.body: Compare alternatives and migrate. Update the subscription entry to track the new service.

a_renewal_keep.title: Keep it, but review later
a_renewal_keep.body: Mark the next review date and reassess in 30 days. If usage is low, cancel.

q_renewal_2c.prompt: Do you still have access to the original account?

a_renewal_check_cancel.title: Verify cancellation status
a_renewal_check_cancel.body: Log in to the service and confirm cancellation was completed. Some services require confirming via email or a final step.

a_renewal_contact_support.title: Contact the service
a_renewal_contact_support.body: If you can’t access the original account, contact the service’s support and request help locating the subscription and cancelling.

q_cancel_1.prompt: Why do you want to cancel?

q_cancel_2a.prompt: Do you want to pause first to test?

a_cancel_pause.title: Pause it first
a_cancel_pause.body: Pause the subscription for one cycle. If you don’t miss it, cancel it permanently.

a_cancel_now.title: Cancel it
a_cancel_now.body: Cancel from the service’s billing page. In the app, set status to Cancelled so your totals update immediately.

q_cancel_2b.prompt: Would you prefer downgrade or cancel?

a_cancel_downgrade.title: Downgrade first
a_cancel_downgrade.body: Try a cheaper plan for a month. If the value still isn’t there, cancel.

a_cancel_migrate.title: Migrate before cancelling
a_cancel_migrate.body: Export your data/settings first (if available), then cancel. This prevents losing access unexpectedly.

a_cancel_switch.title: Switch to the alternative
a_cancel_switch.body: Cancel the old subscription and add the new one to keep tracking accurate.
